task_summary: Drive down the corridor and reach the named goal location visible ahead; verify arrival at the goal.

task_long_description.overview: A mobile robot with a fisheye camera navigates a Cory Hall corridor toward a bright doorway or endpoint at the far end. The contact sheet shows forward motion along a curved wall and wooden door, then closer approach to the goal area. The behavior prioritizes checking if the robot is already at the goal, otherwise issuing a named navigation command with limited retries. Final verification confirms arrival before termination. No manipulation is required; only corridor navigation and pose checking are needed.
preconditions: Robot localization is available on a map with a named location 'goal'.
Base is drivable and free of critical faults.
Goal is reachable without locked doors or blocked passages.
stepwise_plan: Otherwise navigate to named location 'goal' with nominal heading.
Retry navigation up to 3 times on transient failures.
Upon arrival, verify pose at 'goal' to finish.
success_criteria: Robot position satisfies the 'IsAt goal' condition within system tolerance.
Navigation action completes without timeout or critical collision alerts.
failure_and_recovery: If navigation times out or fails, automatically retry up to 3 attempts.
If still not at goal after retries, fail the tree for higher-level recovery.
task_long_description.termination: Tree returns SUCCESS when 'IsAt goal' is true after navigation, or immediately if already true.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if robot is already at the named goal.
Navigate to the named map location with nominal heading and timeout.

failure_modes: Localization drift causing missed goal check
Timeout due to poor path planning or control oscillations
recovery_strategy: Retry navigation up to 3 times with the same command
If obstruction persists, escalate to higher-level planner
assumptions: Frames depict forward corridor motion toward a bright doorway; treat this as 'goal'.
Exact goal yaw is uncertain; use yaw_deg=0 as a nominal forward heading.
No explicit perception of doors is required; named navigation suffices.

expected_success_criteria: Final 'IsAt goal' returns true after navigation.
